item.title: Error help
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

public void triggerTele(int x, int y, int height, boolean prem) { if (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastAction > 5000) { lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis(); resetWalkingQueue(); if (prem && !premium) { sendMessage("This spell is only available to premium members, visit moparisthebest.com/smf for info"); return; } } } public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType){ //Makes Global objects for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){ if(p != null){ client person = (client)p; if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")){ if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){ person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType); } } } }

item.title: Error help
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“the hunt”]yeah he means brackets:
{ or } are brackets[/quote]
Brackets and curly braces are the same thing; in Java, they are called curly braces.

item.title: Error help
item.dc:creator: @dowon8 dowon8
item.description:
@dowon8 wrote:

jc22493:

You have two opening curly braces in the ‘triggerTele’ method; therefore, you must have two closing curly braces to complete the pairs.

Sorry if I’m stupid, but what are curly braces? Can you just fix the code and paste it?

Read full topic

item.title: Error help
item.dc:creator: @dowon8 dowon8
item.description:
@dowon8 wrote:

client.java:1388: illegal start of expression
public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tile
ObjectType){ //Makes Global objects
^
1 error

I tried to add triggertele void thing, but it gave me this error.

Here is where i put it:

[code] public void triggerTele(int x, int y, int height, boolean prem) {
if (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastAction > 5000) {
lastAction = System.currentTimeMillis();
resetWalkingQueue();
if (prem && !premium) {
sendMessage(“This spell is only available to premium members, visit moparisthebest.com/smf for info”);
return;
}

public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType){ //Makes Global objects
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){
if(p != null){
client person = (client)p;
if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != “null”)){
if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){
person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType);
}
}
}
}
}[/code]

Read full topic
